sub_title: Full stack Developer | Ionic Expert | Scrum Master
summary:
Henk is a highly experienced software developer and Scrum Master at ilionx. He has worked on a variety of projects for clients such as the Dutch Postcode Lottery, KPN, Dutch Police, CRV, Rabobank, Belastingdienst, Uitgekookt.nl and Witteveen+Bos

In addition to his professional work, Henk is also an avid organizer of technology events. He has organized events such as a HTML5 Hackathon and a Flight Dart School Event at the Aviodrome flight museum. In 2010, he founded the LinkedIn Group "HTML5 Technologies", which now has over 20,000 members.

When he is not working, Henk enjoys developing apps in his free time, such as "The Math Bus" and "Rijksmuseum: The Masterpieces". In 2015, Henk co-founded DayClocks.nl, a company that helps people with care and remote connection.

Henk's specialties include Ionic Framework, Capacitor, Angular, React, Java, Android, Lean, and Scrum. When he's not working or coding, Henk can be found relaxing or running.

projects.title: Trivento Spring Camp : Microservices in Action
projects.description:
In one afternoon a lot about Micro Services

Using Micro Services is booming. There is much about published and conferences is a current topic. Trivento for the use of Micro Services is an important ingredient to successfully Reactive Systems and we are therefore fully engaged. To share experiences and learn more about the use of Micro Services we organize for the community, for you so, on Friday, March 27th a Spring Camp.
In one afternoon, we are happy to share the knowledge, insights and experiences with Micro Services in different organizations and application areas. For this we have four speakers and a private speaker found that to tell you about here.

projects.title: Math Bus
projects.description:
Math Bus, an app for learning math to children in a simple way (adding, subtracting and a combination of these)

The game consists of :
- different levels
- adding, subtracting and a combination of these
- explanation of the sums

The app is meant for children in the age of 6 till 8.

projects.title: Speaker at Ioniconf 2022
projects.description:
More and more companies want to speed up their development for building apps. Ionic with Amplify are great solutions to achieve this.

Henk will introduce how to build an app with AWS Amplify, setup an app, integrate authentication, and create a data model. He will also talk about how to deploy and host mobile and desktop apps use Appflow and Capacitor

projects.title: Facturatiehub at SIDN
projects.description: Facturatiesysteem voor het verwerken van transacties tot orders die vervolgens verzameld en omgezet moeten worden tot facturen. Omvang was behoorlijk met 10.000.000 herhalende orders en 1.200.000 transacties per maand. Dit alles diende binnen 4 uur omgezet te worden tot facturen.

profile_positions.description:
DayClocks combines the useful with the pleasant; DayClocks offers the important clock functions (analogue, digital, day and part of the day), and also the possibility for family and carers to place messages, calendar appointments and photos on the DayClock, which can be sent from a smartphone, laptop or computer.  With the DayClock10-Duo you can also video call with each other.

With a dementia clock, seniors clock or alzheimer clock in the house, the grip on time (and on life) increases, it supports the care of family / carers and ensures connection and contact between people.

I am responsible for the development of the software, both the Calendar app, and the DayClock itself.

profile_positions.title: Founder

volunteer_experiences.description: Teaching students in the age of 13- 14 coding. The students learning how to create a website, a real mobile app, coding in Python, building 3D a printer and a lot more!

In june I had the opportunity from Devoxx4Kids to give workshop in Boston. Red Hat organises every year the Red Hat Summit. This year Red Hat also hosted for the first time Devoxx4Kids. Devoxx4Kids is an organization to introduce teenagers to programming, robotics and engineering in a fun way. The title of my workshop was Build your own Flappy Bird, to get teens acquainted with HTML5, CSS and Javascript with as result a Flappy Bird game!
